metadata.title: CVE-2018-14348 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
libcgroup up to and including 0.41 creates /var/log/cgred with mode 0666regardless of the configured umask, leading to disclosure of information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14348` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cgroup-bin - 0.41-8ubuntu2+esm1
cgroup-tools - 0.41-8ubuntu2+esm1
libcgroup1 - 0.41-8ubuntu2+esm1
libpam-cgroup - 0.41-8ubuntu2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libcgroup package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.41-8ubuntu2+esm1').
